content.description:
Follows the left-leaning fault across the wall. A semi-girdle traverse? Start on

Kreighton's Bastard Child

, clipping the first bolt. Move left and up, following the line of least resistance, clipping the third bolt on

Commitaphobe

, the third bolt on

Mail Order Bride

and the fourth bolt on

Blushing Bride

, and finishing on that route.
content.location: Start about 6 feet left of the left facing corner at the right of the wall.

content.description: bolted crack to right of Drive Thru Chapel.  short fun.

This climb although short is a pumpy route.

Start in the middle of the wall, pull onto it and go, passing four bolts on your way to the top.
content.location: This route lies on the front face of the free standing block on the right side of the crag.

content.description: Easy warm up/kids climb. Solid jugs and ledges all the way up.
content.location: Head up the hill around the corner of the unknown 5.8. The climb is on the scrambley looking ledges dead ahead.

content.description:
Climb

Commitaphobe

for the first three bolts then break right on a rising traverse up the obvious thin crack.

Finish at the belay of

Drive Through Chapel

.
content.protection: 3 bolts, plus gear to 1".   Open Shut anchors.
content.location: Located in the middle of the wall.

content.description:
Climbs a steep face trending slightly right as the anchors approach.

The difficulties start past the second bolt, and continue  past the next 3 bolts.

The climbing is steep, but thankfully there are some good ledges where rest can be taken.
content.location: Left most route on the wall.

climbs.name: Last Taste of Freedom
climbs.fa: First Lead, 29th May 2020, Euan Cameron and Julie Wright

content.description: Start with a fingery sequence up to gain better holds.   Follow the arete directly until another tricky sequence passing the small overhang gains good holds and the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts to open shuts and a ring are the anchors.   The first 3 are on the left side of the arete.
content.location: Climbs the obvious arete on the right side of the wall.

content.description:
Interesting climbing for the first half of the route keeps you thinking up to the crux sequence.

The crux starts with a stretch out right and then a sequence of moves back left over an overhang. The climbing is steep but the holds although small are positive.
content.location: Located just right of center of the wall, 8 feet left of Drive Through Chapel

content.description:
Climb up steep flakes and crimps, with a difficult move passed the first bolt.  Easier climbing up the face and corner allow a ledge below the 4th bolt to be reached.

Clip the 4th bolt and make the crux moves, up the overhanging corner.

After the crux trend leftwards up the easy corner to the anchors.
content.location: Rightmost bolted line on the main wall

content.description:
Start by climbing the fingery bulge up to the first bolt.   Pass this and continue using large flakes until a good stance is gained at the 3rd bolt.

The sequence after the 3rd bolt is the crux.  Make sure you work your feet high and while holding onto a small crimp with the right hand go for the large hold above.

Keep moving up the steep wall before joining Mail Order Bride shortly before the anchors.

A great route on steep granite.

A short steep route.   Mantle up passed the first bolt, then continue up the steep wall with the crux passing the thrid bolt.    After the crux continue up and right to below the fourth bolt.

Finish easily up the featured slab.
Climb up short wall below the slanting overhang.  Pass the overhang on the right and continue up the steep wall to the anchors.
content.location: This route is located on the buttress 100ft right on the main wall.  The climb take the face to the right of the left edge.
